action.action-desc: Mr. Young of Alaska introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To provide limitations on maritime liens on fishing permits, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Maritime Lien Reform Act.

section.header: Limitation on maritime liens on fishing permit and permit description

subsection.text: Subchapter I of chapter 313 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Limitation on maritime liens on fishing permit and permit description

paragraph.text: does not establish a maritime lien on a permit that—

subparagraph.text: authorizes a person or use of a vessel to engage in fishing; and
is issued under State or Federal law; and

paragraph.text: does not authorize any civil action to enforce a maritime lien on such a permit.
is governed solely by the State or Federal law under which it was issued; and
is not included in the whole of a vessel or as an appurtenance or intangible of a vessel for any purpose.

subsection.text: Nothing in subsections (a) and (b) shall be construed as imposing any limitation upon the authority of the Secretary of Commerce to modify, suspend, revoke, or sanction any Federal fishery permit issued by the Secretary of Commerce or to bring a civil action to enforce such modification, suspension, revocation, or sanction.
The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 31309 the following:

toc.toc-entry: 31310. Limitation on maritime liens on fishing permit and permit description.
